verses.translation: (1) A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen[1748]
(2) To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.
(3) [It is] from Allāh, owner of the ways of ascent.

verses.arabic_text: تَعۡرُجُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيۡهِ فِي يَوۡمٖ كَانَ مِقۡدَارُهُۥ خَمۡسِينَ أَلۡفَ سَنَةٖ
verses.translation: (4) The angels and the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.
(5) So be patient with gracious patience.
(6) Indeed, they see it [as] distant,
(7) But We see it [as] near.
(8) On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,[1749]
(9) And the mountains will be like wool,[1750]
(10) And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,

verses.arabic_text: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمۡۚ يَوَدُّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُ لَوۡ يَفۡتَدِي مِنۡ عَذَابِ يَوۡمِئِذِۭ بِبَنِيهِ
verses.translation: (11) They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children
(12) And his wife and his brother
(13) And his nearest kindred who shelter him

verses.arabic_text: وَمَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ جَمِيعٗا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ
verses.translation: (14) And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.
(15) No![1751] Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],
(16) A remover of exteriors.[1752]
(17) It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]
(18) And collected [wealth] and hoarded.
(19) Indeed, mankind was created anxious:
(20) When evil touches him, impatient,
(21) And when good touches him, withholding [of it],
(22) Except the observers of prayer -
(23) Those who are constant in their prayer
(24) And those within whose wealth is a known right[1753]
(25) For the petitioner and the deprived -
(26) And those who believe in the Day of Recompense

verses.arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنۡ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشۡفِقُونَ
verses.translation: (27) And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord -
(28) Indeed, the punishment of their Lord is not that from which one is safe -
(29) And those who guard their private parts

verses.arabic_text: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزۡوَٰجِهِمۡ أَوۡ مَا مَلَكَتۡ أَيۡمَٰنُهُمۡ فَإِنَّهُمۡ غَيۡرُ مَلُومِينَ
verses.translation: (30) Except from their wives or those their right hands possess,[1754] for indeed, they are not to be blamed -

verses.arabic_text: فَمَنِ ٱبۡتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡعَادُونَ
verses.translation: (31) But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors -
(32) And those who are to their trusts and promises attentive
(33) And those who are in their testimonies upright
(34) And those who [carefully] maintain their prayer:
(35) They will be in gardens,[1755] honored.
(36) So what is [the matter] with those who disbelieve, hastening [from] before you, [O Muḥammad],
(37) [To sit] on [your] right and [your] left in separate groups?[1756]

verses.arabic_text: أَيَطۡمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن يُدۡخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٖ
verses.translation: (38) Does every person among them aspire to enter a garden of pleasure?
(39) No! Indeed, We have created them from that which they know.[1757]

verses.arabic_text: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡمَشَٰرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغَٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَٰدِرُونَ
verses.translation: (40) So I swear by the Lord of [all] risings and settings[1758] that indeed We are able

verses.arabic_text: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيۡرٗا مِّنۡهُمۡ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِينَ
verses.translation: (41) To replace them with better than them; and We are not to be outdone.

verses.arabic_text: فَذَرۡهُمۡ يَخُوضُواْ وَيَلۡعَبُواْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُواْ يَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
verses.translation: (42) So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised -

verses.arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ سِرَاعٗا كَأَنَّهُمۡ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٖ يُوفِضُونَ
verses.translation: (43) The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.[1759]

verses.arabic_text: خَٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةٞۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمُ ٱلَّذِي كَانُواْ يُوعَدُونَ
verses.translation: (44) Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.
